meanings.definition: A protein that forms microfilaments in the cytoskeleton of eukaryotic cells.
meanings.sent1: The actin helps in building the structure of cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how actin shapes cells.
meanings.sent3: The actin in the cell had a party and invited other proteins to join.
meanings.sent4: The actin stood tall like a skyscraper supporting the cell's framework.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the actin looked like a web holding everything together.

meanings.definition: The thin filaments in muscle cells that are composed of actin and myosin proteins.
meanings.sent1: Muscle movement relies on the interaction between actin and myosin.
meanings.sent2: Athletes train to strengthen their actin and myosin fibers.
meanings.sent3: The actin and myosin in the muscle had a race to see who could contract faster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the actin-myosin bond in muscle cells.
meanings.sent5: The actin and myosin danced together, creating the rhythm of movement in the body.
